title: ‘Godfather of AI’ says the technology will create massive unemployment and send profits soaring — ‘that is the capitalist system’
summary:

title: What Apple and Google’s Gemini deal means for both companies
summary:

title: Apple's Patent Grants Declined in 2025 as Innovation Slows
summary:
Apple's U.S. patent activity declined sharply in 2025 amid a broader slowdown in patent filings, according to newly released data from IFI CLAIMS Patent Services.
Total U.S. patent grants in 2025 fell to 323,272, a decline of less than 1% from the previous year, while U.S. patent applications dropped more steeply, falling 9% to 393,344.
Apple's decline occurred as several competitors either held steady or increased their patent output.
Samsung retained the top position for the fourth consecutive year with 7,054 U.S. patent grants, accounting for more than 2% of all patents issued in the United States in 2025.
Apple chip supplier Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) ranked second with 4,194 grants, followed by Qualcomm in third place with 3,749.

title: Pushing China’s EAST Tokamak Past The Greenwald Density Limit
summary:

We covered these details with nuclear fusion reactors in great detail last year, noting the importance of plasma edge stability, as this causes tokamak wall erosion as well as loss of energy.
The EAST tokamak (HT-7U) is a superconducting tokamak that was upgraded and resumed operations in 2014, featuring a 1.85 meter major radius and 7.5 MW heating power.
As a tokamak the issue of plasma and edge stability are major concerns, even in H-mode, requiring constant intervention.

title: Insta360’s face-tracking webcams get bigger sensors and more expensive
summary:
Insta360 has announced new Pro versions of its Link 2 and Link 2C webcams that first launched in September 2024.
Both webcams are now available worldwide through Insta360’s online store and Amazon, but are slightly more expensive than the $199 Link 2 and $149 Link 2C.
Video resolutions stay the same, however, with both the Link 2 Pro and Link 2C Pro maxing out at 4K/30fps, or up to 60fps at 1080p.
The Insta360 Link 2C Pro is smaller than the Link 2 Pro but doesn’t have a two-axis gimbal to physically move its camera while tracking.
The Stream Deck support will also be coming to the Link 2 and Link 2C webcams.
